items.title: Manitoba Tories defend reaction to 'politically charged' Transgender Day of Remembrance speech
items.summary_auto: A day after a majority of Manitoba PC MLAs refused to stand in the chamber following a statement recognizing the Transgender Day of Remembrance, NDP members repeatedly heckled the Tories in the legislature, with the premier calling the PC leader a "bigot."

items.title: Canada Post, union agree in principle to deal after 2 years of contentious bargaining
items.summary_auto: Canada Post and the union representing thousands of mail carriers across the country say the parties have reached agreements in principle after two years of contentious bargaining.

items.title: Ottawa, Alberta expected to sign new energy sector deal on Thursday: source
items.summary_auto: Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith are expected to sign an agreement on the future of Alberta's energy sector on Thursday, according to a senior federal government source.

items.title: Waterboarding, sexual assault, disguises: Details of terrifying $2M B.C. bitcoin hostage-taking revealed
Seeing Paul McCartney in Hamilton — possibly his last show in Canada — will be 'earth-shattering,' fan says
items.summary_auto: When Paul McCartney plays tonight at Hamilton’s newly renovated TD Coliseum for the last Canadian date of his Got Back tour, it’s going to be hard for fans not to think that, after decades of extraordinary contributions to popular music, we are somewhere close to the end.

items.title: ByHeart baby formula recalled in Canada as infant botulism cases in U.S. climb
items.summary_auto: Canadian officials are warning the public not to consume recalled ByHeart Whole Nutrition Infant Formula because it may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum tied to infant illnesses in the U.S.

items.title: New Ken Burns series features Indigenous nations' role in American Revolution
items.summary_auto: Ken Burns’s new documentary series on the American Revolution includes history often left out of textbooks: the economic and diplomatic roles sovereign Indigenous nations had in the creation of the United States.

items.title: Top court says federal prisoners can challenge security transfer denials before judge
items.summary_auto: The Supreme Court of Canada has ruled federal inmates can challenge the refusal to transfer them to lower security prisons on the grounds their liberty is deprived.

items.title: Teachers were 'heroes' in protecting students from grizzly attack on B.C.'s Central Coast, officials say
Some stars of new Fox News Bible podcast say they didn't know it was happening
items.summary_auto: This week, Fox News Media announced the Life Of Jesus podcast, featuring actors such as Kristen Bell and Brian Cox. Following the announcement, Bell and Cox have said they didn't know about the project until now.

items.title: A wildfire reduced this B.C. fire hall to rubble in 2023. Now, they're rebuilding
items.summary_auto: After operating out of a storage facility for the last two and a half years, construction on the new Scotch Creek Fire Hall has begun in B.C. 's Shuswap region.

items.title: Trump and Mamdani praise each other after meeting face to face at White House
Fans heartbroken, angry as Winnipeg's Valour FC announces suspension of operations
items.summary_auto: Winnipeg's professional men's soccer club, Valour FC, announced Friday it has suspended operations.

items.title: Miss Universe is crowned in a pageant plagued by controversy and chaos
items.summary_auto: Fátima Bosch Fernández wiped away tears as she was crowned Miss Universe 2025 in Bangkok on Friday. It was a dramatic victory for Bosch, 25, in a pageant plagued by controversy and chaos — perhaps even more so than usual.

items.title: J.D. Vance says Canada's standard of living is stagnant and immigration is to blame
Canadian actor Spencer Lofranco dead at 33
items.summary_auto: Canadian actor Spencer Lofranco, who appeared in the films Gotti and King Cobra, has died at age 33.

items.title: Man found dead at coal mine in Sparwood, B.C.
items.summary_auto: A 39-year-old man has died in a Sparwood, B.C., mine following an incident that the company says occurred during maintenance work.

items.title: Gun charges dropped against 2 Sikh activists
items.summary_auto: Two of three Sikh separatists arrested for firearms offences have had all charges against them dropped. The third, Inderjit Singh Gosal, replaced Hardeep Singh Nijjar as leader of the Sikh independence referendum campaign in Canada following Nijjar's 2023 assassination.

items.title: Former Regina officer pleads guilty to using police databases to pursue women
items.summary_auto: On Friday, Robert Eric Semenchuck pleaded guilty to breach of trust and unauthorized use of a computer.

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine may face 'very difficult choice' as U.S. gives deadline on peace plan
items.summary_auto: Ukraine may face a hard choice at a pivotal point in its almost four-year fight to defeat Russia's full-scale invasion, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy told Ukrainians in a national address Friday, pledging to hold constructive discussions with Washington on a U.S. peace proposal in what he called "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."

items.title: Children's shoes lit by candles at Manitoba Legislature honour youngest victims of Russia's war in Ukraine
items.summary_auto: Hundreds of children's shoes lined the steps of the Manitoba Legislature on Thursday during a sombre ceremony where families gathered to honour the lives of children who have died in Ukraine since the Russian invasion.

items.title: 89 civilians killed in Islamic State-linked rebel attacks in east Congo: UN force
items.summary_auto: Islamic State-linked rebels have killed 89 civilians in multiple attacks in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo's Lubero territory, the United Nations peacekeeping mission in the Central African country said on Friday.

items.title: Calgary converting 9 more vacant office buildings into housing
items.summary_auto: The City of Calgary has released the details of nine new projects through its downtown office conversion program, creating close to 1,000 homes.

items.title: Donation of Second World War grenade prompts Ontario thrift store evacuation
items.summary_auto: A Second World War grenade prompted the closure of a Chatham-Kent thrift store Thursday afternoon, police said.

items.title: Pilot killed as Indian fighter jet crashes at Dubai Air Show
items.summary_auto: An Indian HAL Tejas crashed Friday local time while flying a demonstration flight for a crowd at the Dubai Air Show, sending black smoke over the Maktoum International Airport in the Emirates. It wasn't immediately clear if the pilot ejected the aircraft.

items.title: Does Alexa understand your toddler? Western University researchers are looking into it
items.summary_auto: Two researchers at Western University in London, Ont., are studying how to improve the way artificial intelligence understands toddlers' speaking patterns. They're recruiting preschool-age children to examine how they speak and use that data to train an AI model.

items.title: Serial killer Dellen Millard, who murdered Tim Bosma, Laura Babcock, moved to medium-security prison
items.summary_auto: Serial killer Dellen Millard has been moved from a maximum-security prison to a medium-security facility in Ontario, CBC News has learned.

items.title: Roughly 500,000 Canadians left ERs before seeing a doctor last year, data shows
items.summary_auto: About half a million people left emergency departments across Canada before being seen by a doctor last year, according to data analysis by CBC’s Marketplace.

items.title: What's behind the spike in jewelry store smash-and-grabs in Ontario
items.summary_auto: A growing number of minors are being recruited by adults to carry out smash-and-grab jewelry store robberies in Ontario and are told that if they are caught, as youths, they would face little or no time in custody, an investigation by CBC's the fifth estate has found.

items.title: Europe says Russia is ramping up a sabotage campaign. It just doesn’t know how to deal with it
items.summary_auto: When Poland announced that an explosion damaged a railway track leading to Ukraine this week, Prime Minister Donald Tusk was quick to declare it was an unprecedented act of sabotage designed to cause catastrophe.

items.title: Mexico City plans exhumation of 6,600 bodies in search for disappeared
items.summary_auto: Mexico City began a project this week to exhume and identify thousands of bodies from an area of common graves in a municipal cemetery as part of a multi-agency strategy to deal with its growing list of people registered as disappeared.

items.title: Why Canada is winning the travel trade war with the U.S.
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump’s divisive politics, tariffs and heightened border security have helped drive a decline in international tourism spending in the U.S. Meanwhile, polls and industry experts suggest a surge of Canadian patriotism and perceptions of Canada as a safe and friendly destination helped drive a record-breaking summer for tourism in the country.

items.title: China might be winning the AI race. Does it matter?
items.summary_auto: A Beijing company recently released China's smartest artificial intelligence model yet — narrowing the gap between that country and the U.S. in a race that some have likened to a new cold war.

items.title: What's the best way to improve access to psychologists in Canada?
items.summary_auto: The number of hours needed to start working as a psychologist seeing patients in Ontario could be slashed under proposed changes aimed at boosting the province's supply of the health professionals.

items.title: Is pharmacare on ice? Health minister says no new deals with provinces in the works
items.summary_auto: Canada’s public drug insurance program appears to be in limbo, with the Carney government failing to earmark any new money to expand coverage to the rest of the country.
